review.title: Nice room with very good breakfast
review.reviewText: Perfect for one night stay and very good and clean breakfast.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine.  But, that's it.  The staff was nice and helpful, though.  It is very close to the airport, which is good.  I noticed some people actually catching the bus at the front door, to get to the airport. Convenient.

There are other hotels in the area, depending on your budget, a LaQuinta is right next door.

review.title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
review.reviewText:
I had made a reservation to stay here overnight after a trip back to the mainland from Hawaii. It was a stopover, and we had to leave fairly early the next morning for another flight. We got in late at night and I called for their shuttle--LONG time before it came. It was 11:30 before we got to the hotel.

Turns out that THEY DID NOT HAVE OUR ROOM--there had been a problem with our credit card, and they rented out the room. There were NO rooms available, at this hotel or ANYWHERE near the airport. THEY NEVER CONTACTED US, and were not concerned that we were stranded, late at night, at their hotel.

In the end, we took their shuttle back to the airport and spent a sleepless night listening to loud TSA announcements . . . .
review.negativeRemarks: NOTIFY CUSTOMERS WHEN THERE ISN'T A ROOM AVAILABLE!!!!

review.title: Nice, close to airport
review.reviewText: Good check in, close to food places, transportation

review.title: DOOLS
review.reviewText:
Best Days Inn I've ever stayed in.  
Front Desk Clerk was rude but room & accomodations were excellent.  Perfect location for easy access to SFO Airport.

review.title: Nice, close to mall
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room with some extras. TV easy to operate
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is tight,but par for the location
review.locationRemarks: Shopping mall and freeway close by.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to airport.
review.reviewText: It was pleasant. We had to wait for our paper work as the computer went down.  We got a call around 9:00 p.m. To go sign the paper work. We were told we had to go right away .  It had to be done before midnight
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport

review.title: Nice hotel close to SF
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean, and staff is nice. Price is decent.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a bigger parking lot. It's first come first serve, street parking is also available.
review.locationRemarks: They have a couple of breakfast spots available.

review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't bad. The staff weren't very friendly. They had a great breakfast set up. The room was perfect for what me and my husband were looking for. Good location. Lots of food surrounding area. There's even a mall 3 miles away

review.title: a good night sleep
review.reviewText: Late check in is a pain. No food menu, yet have room service menu. Shuttle driver very pleasant.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to SFO and so easy to make early morning flights.  Lobby and elevators need to be upgraded.  THe room was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby and elevators need to be upgraded.

review.title: A quick one day turn around trip.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff tries hard to please; however, need professional repair person to fix inoperable lighting fixture.

review.title: Expensive
review.reviewText: Used two nights. Short staff. Piling trash at breakfast room.

review.title: Just the basics
review.reviewText: No one at the desk for 15 minutes upon check in. No hair dryer in room. If you needed one you had to take the elevator down 2 flights and borrow one from desk.  No outlet in bathroom . Desk clerk had scant knowledge of good restaurants nearby, they will never see us again even though we are through the airport at least 3 times per year.

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText: Rooms are ok   Close to airport. No other facility. Good if you arrive late and depart early.
rooms were a tight space for 4 people with luggage. no reason to complain, no reason to return

review.title: Flying early
review.reviewText: Hotel did what we needed it to do good area and good food close walking

review.title: great place great location for airpiort great staf
review.reviewText: staff really helped us at checkin and gave us an upgraded suite for same price !!
Nice place great to have elevator and beds are super comfy

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Good distance from airport. Breakfast reasonable.

review.title: Functional
review.reviewText: Good value near airport for early morning departures.

review.title: Good choice for 1 night stay
review.reviewText: Basic hotel, perfect for sleeping near the airport. Very comfortable be and fairly large room. The AC controls were very confusing and it made a lot of noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to our daughter's house and BART.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a sign showing the way to the lobby from the parking lot. We walked all the way around the hotel because we couldn't find the entrance. Noisy AC.

review.title: Affordable and convenient
review.reviewText: The Hotel is generally in good shape as it seems to be newly renovated.  Rooms are clean and front desk staff are friendly.  They could use more staff to man the breakfast area to keep up with the replenishment of stuff like coffee or plates & others.
review.positiveRemarks: conveniently located close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Hazard items like some electrical cabling sticking out of the floor (in the breakfast area) must be protected and covered/labeled so people are safe.
review.locationRemarks: there are shops around the area and coin laundry within walking distance.

review.title: good for SFO access
review.reviewText: hotel is currently being remodeled.  Access to it is difficult from the street due to traffic barriers.  Rooms are relatively quiet and new remodel is a great improvement, but lobby is very confined and check-in has no temporary parking.
review.negativeRemarks: more front desk staff.  Even when I rang their counter bell, no one came.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to SFO

review.reviewText: It was fine but all we did was sleep there most of the days we were in the city.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Under construction, order place, but not too expensive.

review.title: Only positive was close to airport
review.reviewText: Terrible terrible terrible Extremely noisy and staff very rude.  They could have cared less that we did not want the rooms that they assigned us.  They were right next to the lobby and you could hear every word that was said all night.  The elevator broke sometime during the wee early morning hours and there was beating and pounding.  Maybe someone trying to get out of the elevator.  Kids were running all over upstairs.  It was a nightmare and none of us in the three rooms slept the entire night.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: Went to the airport

review.title: The only positive thing was that it was close  to
review.reviewText: Terrible.  Noisy beyond words. Extremely rude staff and manager.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport that is all that was positive

review.title: Horrible service.
review.reviewText: I was unable to utilize my hotel room because a passenger on my flight had to be escorted off by paramedics and it was late arriving at the destination.  I was supposed to arrive around 1 AM which is why I booked the hotel but ended up arriving at 5 AM which was then too late for a hotel stay.  The hotel wouldn't do ANYTHING to help me out with either cancelling or rescheduling for a different night.  The company standards are low enough that when something happens that is 1000% outside of the consumer's control they're unwilling to do anything as a courtesy.  $130 wasted on this hotel and it was completely outside of my control.  I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone simply based on absolutely poor customer service.

review.title: The room was comfortable and clean.
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and clean. Parking was limited.

review.title: REFURBISHED BUT NOT WORTH THE MONEY
review.reviewText:
At double the rate for previous years I was expecting it to be more together, it's not

The front desk was unmanned most of the time with half hearted desk staff

The breakfast selection is less than before and got very well looked after, green bananas being the only fruit available, very disappointing 

The wifi is appalling for the price, try complaining gets you nowhere 

The rooms upgraded but the facilities haven't, my room faces out onto El Camino, it would be nice if I could close the curtains, looking at the neon sign for Zorbas over the road is not sleep inducing 

It was OK at the old rate, for this kind of money next time I'm going somewhere else 

All travelers need good Wifi, this is an essential these days, about time Days Inn did something at a corporate level not just take the dividends

Not worth the money 2/5
review.negativeRemarks:
Wifi 

Desk staff

Decent breakfast
review.locationRemarks: On El Camino with a rather greasy restaurant/take out across the road

review.title: close to airport but also San Bruno and Millbrae
review.reviewText: surprised..no hair dryer in room.  minor inconvenience.
Very clean and courteous staff ...was impressed with the continental breakfast.....would stay there again
Very nice and clean.  Hotel staff was super nice.  Room service food was decent.  Better than other hotels of this level around the SFO.

We had a pleasant experience at Days Inn! Unfortunately it was under construction so you couldn't see the hotel at its full potential. The staff was very pleasant. We arrived at 2:30 and he went ahead and checked us in and gave us our room. We greatly appreciated that after the long drive. The room was a bit small compared to the pictures but the decor was nice and the was clean. Bed was great, slept well!!! Overall experience was nice. Will stay here again.

Breakfast does not go until 9am. They start putting food away by 8:30. I was in the middle of making a waffle, and the staff took away the syrup and butter right in front of me. I was shocked. When I asked if she could wait or bring it back, she told me no. I couldn't believe how rude and unwelcoming she acted.

review.title: Not a very good place to stay. Would not recommend
review.reviewText: Extra charges  and manager very unfriendly, parking was a nitemare.

Under renovation 

Slow check in

Didn't have change for vending

Nothing close and open for dinner

review.title: Ok but worse than expected.
review.reviewText: Bad pillows, small room, very slow internet. Parking lot is quite small.
About a  10 min drive from airport. Managers at desk very nice   For price it is worth it
Thank you for your serving. I had a comfortable relaxing and sleep.

review.title: It's under renovation right now but still okay hot
review.reviewText: Location is great.  Near restaurants and airport.. I liked the hotel even though it is being renovated.  I think it will make the hotel very nice and a great value when it is done
Under construction. No amenities in early morning. & airport shuttles only every hour (not mentioned in website)

review.title: Updates desperately needed. Substandard breakfast.
review.reviewText: We were disappointed with this hotel. Overpriced for condition of facility. Poor breakfast, outdated decor, rundown property.

review.title: Airport Easy!
review.reviewText: The location to the airport makes this hotel a winner! Parking was good (and i drive a big truck). FAST checkin was welcomed after long red-eye flight. the continental breakfast was less than desirable. Overall, i would recommend for airport ease.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport.
review.reviewText: Good hotel.  Under going some updates ,  so should be better soon.  Bathroom could use better lighting.

review.title: Not recommended even for a reasonable rate.
review.reviewText: poor customer service, was not aware hotel was under renovation, unsanitary condition in the breakfast area, coffee tasted water downed, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable, and room  was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service, and notification of Hotel being under renovation should be in bold print online.
review.locationRemarks: Location was ideal and convenient for the purpose of our trip, parking at nite can be a problem.

review.reviewText: The desk clerk was very helpful. However, there were soiled linens in the floor of the bathroom when we arrived. The complimentary continental breakfast was sparse.

review.title: Needed hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: No hair drier in room. Very inconvenient. Hotel being renovated tools and supplies stacked in hallways.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room was good. The clerk at the desk was helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Spruce it up.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.

review.title: Fine and cheap if youre not looking for top notch
review.reviewText: Customer service is friendly but not attentative. The person at the front desk took a long time to come to the front. When he did, he was using two different phones talking to someone about reservations and transportation, right in front of me for about 2-3 minutes. It came off as kind of rude but I know he didnt intend that. Room was excellent and clean, quiet too. It was advertised at $100 adn totaled around $113 after tax. There's one computer to use for business purposes. I was looking online at other hotels and for $115 I could have stayed at The Westin airport hotel. You can never go wrong with a Westin and I regret not booking with them. The shuttles only came once an hour, which is not efficient especially when you have people needing to catch a flight. I came downstairs in the morning and he said the shuttle was already gone. I wasnt late either so why was it not there waiting? I ended up taking Uber that got lost trying to find my destination to my interview and didnt make it on time, so my trip was a complete waste. Atleast the Westin has shuttles coming every 15-20. At checkout me and another guest were waiting about 10 minutes for someone to come to the front. How can you run a business with no one there to run it??? The floor construction workers were very nice though and noticed us waiting so they went in the back to let the worker know we were waiting.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and rooms were clean, updated and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: More frequent shuttle times are needed and courtesy phone call that shuttles are arriving would be nice.

review.title: Everything was great.
review.reviewText: I would like to come back here again. Best hotel in San Bruno.

review.title: ok for one night
review.reviewText: Upon checking in could not understand front desk clerk....he was friendly, but could not understaand his dialect.  Room was very small for a king size bed.  Bathroom tub/shower needs  safety bar or something...nothing to hold onto getting in and out of shower.  Room was clean and you could tell recently spruced up.  We were on the first floor, street level which I would not reccommend. Pillows were hard. Parking very limited and tight.  As for places to eat in the vicinity...choices not good at all.  We tried Toto's, Italian Pizzeria.  Walked in and walked out. Best place to eat within a short drive...Chilli's...at least you know what you ar getting.
review.locationRemarks: nothing...

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: Nice room, but the lobby area was dirty. Promised breakfast was nearly non existent. No food left, garbage overfilled and not emptied, coffee empty. Just an overall lack of attention.
The staff speak horrible English. Computer systems weren't working for check out. Room was remodeled kind of small. Beds were comfortable.

review.title: Pleasant and clean
review.reviewText: Clean room.  Staff was excellent and very helpful.  Accommodated my tight schedule to be in and out

review.title: The room was fine, just very loud outside
review.reviewText: Lots of construction and super loud outside from the train but for the price it was fine.
Good hotel, interior was just renovated. All new furniture and appliances but very badly maintained. It could be much better if stuff and management would do a better job.

review.title: Newly renovated Reasonably priced
review.reviewText: I have sleep problems due to a light sleeper but room seemed like it was sound proof even while being on the main street.  Didn't hear anything slept well & beds very comfy nice & firm.  Had an early flight had to leave hotel at 4am Nick (owner) made arrangements for us to get cereal 2 hrs before beakfast start time.   The only bad thing was the overnight lady did not have any coffee ready at that time.  Had to drive down the road to 711 for coffee.  But I give it 5 stars

review.title: Convenient & Good Value
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and cordial. Rooms were adequate and the proximity to SFO and BART very good.

review.title: Not accessible
review.reviewText: We did not stay because it advertised shuttle to airport but did not provide long term parking. So we left.

review.title: Last resort
review.reviewText: Elevator wasn't working, drains were clogged, and the entire hotel smelled of incense.
We stay one nigth. Quiet, clean and easy access from and to the airport.

review.title: Nothing close by at all
review.reviewText: Checked me into a room that was still under reno. Then moved into a nice room still no fridge or microwave.The whole place was under construction even Christmas day was a waist of money my wife is 6 months pregnant was I'll the whole trip from the fumes
I was there for 5 nights the service was excellent area was descent and safe. The Breakfast was awesome. My room was clean everyday with fresh towels. I really enjoyed my stay and I will come back.
review.positiveRemarks: I will close to the expressway and 5 to 10 minutes from the bart. All the restaurant will close by 5 to 10 minutes. Shopping mall too 10 to 15 minutes

review.title: Close to the airport and a number of restaurants
review.reviewText: A good place getting even better!! VERY accommodating management, great location and facilities undergoing non intrusive upgrading!
review.locationRemarks: There's a great Greek pizza place directly across the street.

review.title: Yuck!
review.reviewText: This hotel is currently under renovation so maybe when it's finished there will be a different experience, but I was completely disappointed with the condition of the hotel in our room. The carpet was visibly  dirty, the wallpaper was coming off the walls in the bathroom, we could hear the people in the room next to us coughing all night long, and breakfast left a lot to be desired.  We originally booked this room because it had a pack and play available for our baby. When we got there they did not have one available. The people at the front desk were friendly but other than that I was incredibly disappointed.

review.title: Airport shuttle yes, but otherwise, no
review.reviewText: The hotel must be under renovations, but they probably should let people know that when you check in (to set expectations) since it's not a friendly environment. Elevator was broken and I had to walk up 3 flights of stairs with my bags. Yes, the front desk clerk asked if I needed help with my bags, but honestly, with 3 flights to go up, he should have just said he'd have someone take them up for me. On my way up the stair well, I saw two bagged up mattresses and some kind of decaying piece of fruit. And then there was a pile of building tiles and some other building materials stacked outside the room next door to mine (at 8:00 pm). Inside my room, where there used to be a connecting door, there was just drywall with patched up areas. Once i was in my room, the television did not work, or the phone (I had to plug it in to another jack). Once I got the phone working, I called downstairs and the front clerk came up to get the tv working. Lastly, there are very thin walls (I could hear my next door neighbors carrying on their conversations for hours) and thin windows, so loud street noise. I only needed a bed for overnight before a flight, but I wouldn't ever stay here again unless the renovations fix the issues I had.

review.title: Price reasonable but room/facilites can be better
review.reviewText:
I booked the king business room as the website indicated it was an oversized room. A friend of mine also has the same room booked. We were international travellers have 4 luggages for each couple so we needed a bigger room. When checking in, the guy at the counter explained that they could not give us one of the business room. He did not explain so I had to ask him why. Then he replied that the room is flooded. I inquired that we paid for a business place and he had the cheek to tell us that it was only $10 more and that the replacement double queen bed room is bigger than our king business room. We were puzzled. So why did we bother to book the business room? Anyway, the room is not oversized but not too small. 

My TV box keeps loosing signal and throughout my 4 days stay, we can watch minimum TV. We did inform the lady at the reception but nothing was resolved. 

Parking at the facility is limited but we still managed to get our lot every night. There are other street parking behind the hotel. 

The breakfast is really below expectation There were some pre-made omelette stored in the mini fridge with the yoghurts. If you want to eat eggs, you need to microwave them yourself. There is a DIY waffle maker but the waffle results are mostly soft, not crisp. Batter problem probably.There are very few tables and since the hotel has tourist crowds, they hang out at the lobby occupying all the seats. We have no place but to drive over to nearby Jack in the box for our morning fix.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location is near to SFO and free shuttle service can be arranged.
There is a hot water dispenser that you can get 24 hrs.
review.negativeRemarks:
Hairdryer very powerful but handles turn sticky due to oxidation.
Dish TV lost signal
Breakfast
Constant stench of indian spice smell in Lobby
review.locationRemarks: Trader Joes and Safeway are near.

review.title: Perfect for a stay close to the SF airport.
review.reviewText: Good shuttle service to SF airport. Staff was excellent to deal with.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating room furniture.
review.locationRemarks: BART station only a mile away and you can get to downtown SF from there without driving.

review.title: Would not stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel room was located on the first floor by the lobby. It had the Days Inn sign outside of our window, so the room was not dark at night. You could also hear the street traffic all night.

review.title: A remodel too pricey
review.reviewText:
The staff was excellent. The hotel was very clean and, for the small space, well laid out. Attractive decor. 
However mattresses were uncomfortable. Backs talking to us next morning. Chairs and sofa in lobby cheaply made. Sit in them and cushions have no support.  Breakfast adequate but I saw no fruit.
What we paid was overpriced for what we got. (The night before we stayed in a beautiful hotel in Burlingame for much  less and got a huge breakfast buffet, extremely well made furniture and comfortable beds, beautiful ambiance.)
This place was okay but not for the price. Staff and cleanliness the best part.
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff. Extremely polite, welcoming, helpful.
The motel was immaculate. Very well kept and for the small lobby, well laid out.
review.negativeRemarks:
Mattresses. 
Lobby chairs....looked good but no support in the seats. 
Fresh fruit at breakfast...or if they had it, enough to last the entire time.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown Millbrae had some great little restaurants and coffee houses.  Of course, close to Burlingame, a great town to shop, walk, eat.

review.title: CLOSE TO SFO INTERNATIONAL
review.reviewText:
The room was spotlessly clean, comfortable beds and good WiFi, which all you really want

The free breakfast had a good choice and it was also spotlessly clean, the staff were very polite and most helpful

It was surprisingly quiet being so close to SFO so it makes a perfect place for travellers in transit, I've used it three times now and understand from the manager it's due for remodelling in the near future, so I'll definitely be back when I pass through San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds, cleanliness and courtesy of the staff
review.negativeRemarks: It's looking a little dated, but not worn, so the imminent remodel with sort that out
review.locationRemarks:
Close to SFO and free shuttle which only takes around 15 minutes it's well placed

There's a decent restaurant across the road, very handy

review.reviewText: The elevator permit had expired and staff had said it's out of order even though it runs perfectly fine.  Housekeeping finally ripped the "Out of Order" sign after the 2nd day.  The breakfast is average but the run out of bananas very early.  The room had some sort of smell to it and the AC barely worked and we needed the AC as we were there during summer time.

review.title: Bed bugs
review.reviewText: We found bed bugs in the room.  When reported to the staff, was told the room had been exterminated 2 weeks prior.  Clearly they have a bed bug problem.   Shuttle from the airport had to be called and always took 30 minutes even when told it would be 10 min.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the bugs. Update the hotel.

review.title: Close to airport / couple nice restaurants nearby
review.reviewText: Area ok to walk in. Close to fast food, restaurants, and drug stores.
review.negativeRemarks: Free airport shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Nice Mexican restauant

review.title: Close to SFO airport!
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because it was close to the airport and we had an early flight out the next day
review.positiveRemarks: It was an excellent choice for staying one night before flying out the next morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Very dated
review.locationRemarks: There is not much to do right near the hotel, but there are several cities near by with things to do

review.title: Ok for overnight before going to the airport
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Days Inn because compared to other airport hotels it's reasonably priced, and has a free shuttle to the airport.  The room and bathroom are clean.  The TV is a bit cumbersome to use.  Just pointing the remote at the TV does not change the channels because the cable box is attached to the back of the TV, so I had to stand right in front of the TV and point the remote over it to change channels.  

The breakfast is free so don't expect much.  Two kinds of cereal, oatmeal, bread, do-it-yourself waffles, yogurt, pre-cooked eggs in the fridge which looked awful, coffee/tea, juice and bananas.

The free shuttle stops at several hotels before going to the airport.  It took about half an hour from Days Inn to the United domestic terminal!  So take this timing into account when you reserve space on the shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do nearby.  The only reason to stay here is to be close to the airport.

review.reviewText: Convenient to airport, helpful staff, easy check-out.

review.title: Not clean hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Very dirty carpet, smells bad, ripped sheets.  We had to stay since we prepaid through Expedia or we wouldn't even stay the first night. Provided only one little soap for shower and hand wash.  The rating was good but we found out it is not accurate.  Honest, just pay a little more and stay at nicer place.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the entire carpets, they have holes in them.  I think the owners (India) beaten a dead horse.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Not what I had hoped for ...
review.reviewText:
The location worked but I was disappointed.  The room was not what I had hoped for.  The refrigerator door would not close - it had tape marks as if duct tape had been used in the past to keep it close.  We had bought food to store so we had to prop our bag in front of the door to keep it closed but our food still spoiled.

We put up the do not disturb sign however housekeeping paid it no attention.  

The breakfast bar was not good.  Food was spoiled or stale.  

The curtains in the dining area were filthy and shredded.

I don't typically write reviews however when other soccer parents spoke of their hotel in which they paid a similar rate, I found myself frustrated that we stayed at this location.

review.title: Clean, quiet, close to airport
review.reviewText: Satisfied all my needs.  Quiet, restful atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Information about shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Great pizza place across the street

review.title: Over-rated
review.reviewText: The hotel was "tired".  Room was dirty; noisy from aircraft taking off and people in hall; breakfast area was too small.  Definitely not worth the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle from airport - although this was s-l-o-w and made many stops.  Took too long to rely on this for shuttle TO the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: More honest reviews would have helped.

review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our stay at Days Inn, the room  was basic but clean and comfortable.
Location is great if you have a rental car.
Would stay here again.

review.title: Good hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights, friendly staff, breakfast is ok, room is good, clean

review.title: Gross, dirty, unhelpful staff, not worth the money
review.reviewText: Title says it all - even for a jet-lagged traveler just wanting sleep, this hotel was gross. The upstairs hallways spelled of hot overpowering cinnamon, no ventilation in the room, and carpets and walls looked like they'd been in a frat house for decades. I would not recommend staying here to anyone - a very poor showing of a Days Inn. I felt cleaner walking barefoot through airport security than I did showering here.

review.title: Good if you're tight on money.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because money was tight. Money won't ever be THAT'S tight again. Dirty hotel. Staff were nice and breakfast was good but that's about it.
Stayed there one night, they had a free shuttle to/from the airport. A little bit expensive for what it is, but no complaints otherwise.
Just a quick overnight between late night and 11 am.
The hotel was fine. We cannot complain about anything.

review.title: Clean and Affordable Hotel
review.reviewText: The shuttle service from SFO was quick and free so that was a plus. I arrived at the hotel and was promptly greeted and given my room keys. The room was clean and acceptable, nothing extraordinary just clean and acceptable. The bed was a bit too firm for me, the pillows were lacking, I had only 3 and they were semi-square pillows. The bathroom was good, clean and ready to use - thank you. Daily room service was on top of it, I would come back except it is really far from the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and ready to use each day. Breakfast was okay.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were a bit hard, the pillows were really small. There is also no facilities on site, no work out, hot tub or hot sauna.

review.title: Nice hotel only minutes to the SFO
review.reviewText: Arrived at 4:00 pm and room was ready.  Nice room.  Sink did not drain well.  Beds fairly comfortable.  Staff pleasant.  Staying there again on Aug. 6.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows and sink drain

review.title: the people were nice but the food and cofee bad
review.reviewText: everything we try to eat tasted old, especially cofee
review.negativeRemarks: clean room and fresh cofee
review.locationRemarks: close to San Francisco

review.reviewText: Near the San Francisco Airport. The room is nice and clean.

review.title: Not the Best.
review.reviewText:
Would not recommend to anyone. Carpet was worn, wall paper peeling in several places in bathroom.  Drapes were dirty, with something smeared all over them.  Noise outside of room in
parking lot adjacent to room.  Not a very good area of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needed remodeling.
review.locationRemarks: In an industrial area which is a little ran down.

review.title: Days Inn SFO
review.reviewText: Close to Airport, shuttle stops at several hotels so leave extra time. Desk staff very nice
review.negativeRemarks: Door was a bit iffy and window at ground level slightly damaged
review.locationRemarks: Good Mexican food across the street

review.reviewText: OK facility, good for short term stay. Clean and quite, but wifi really slow. All in all, good for the night before an early flight.

review.title: Everything you need
review.reviewText: Simple, clean accommodations with everything you need.  Adjustable thermostat, satellite TV, free wifi, frig, microwave, hairdryer, shower cap (you don't see that anymore).
review.negativeRemarks: Street numbers on El Camino Real are not  consistent.  Hard to find -- even the taxi driver got lost.

review.title: Served its purpose
review.reviewText: We needed a hotel near the airport that also had a shuttle and free wifi.  The Days Inn on San Bruno isn't fancy, but it served its purpose and was clean and comfortable.  Appreciated being able to leave our bags prior to check-in so we could go and enjoy the Giants game.
review.negativeRemarks: There wasn't a counter in the bathroom, so we had no place to stash our toiletries.

review.title: Pleasant motel close to SFO and BART
review.reviewText: I looked at all the Expedia™ and others' listings for San Francisco and concluded that there was NOTHING that was both affordable and decent in the entire city of San Francisco! Each listing was either a dump (awful reviews) or grossly overpriced! This motel is pleasant, affordable, and within easy reach of San Francisco by BART or car. Excellent if you want to spend a day or more in San Francisco and have a good place to spend the night nearby. Free, secure parking included!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, decent rates, adequate rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast included. Quiet. Very adequate free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Next to SFO and easy access to San Francisco by car or BART. There are shops all along El Camino Real, as close as you want.

review.title: close to airport - good value
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel because it was close to the airport and a good price. Very satisfied - would book again.
review.locationRemarks: Good place to sleep.  Nothing to do near by.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. The room are large and clean with all comfort. And the location right in the city is very convenient

review.title: Comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: Hassle free check in with friendly staffs. Room is pretty big compared to a hotel in San Francisco. Room is clean enough. Breakfast is simple and nothing great but definitely good enough for a filling meal.

review.title: Beware using Expedia to book at this hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was located in a nice safe area and parking was plentiful. We were issued a room on the ground floor and i tried to switch it for the upper floor. The person at the desk said since we booked through Expedia we can not move our room. the ground floor room is what you get as those rooms are slated for Expedia. They made me feel like a second class citizen.

Other than that the breakfast was great and the room was clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms and breakfast, safe parking with security cameras.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom had maintenance issues

review.reviewText:
Had a pleasant stay at the hotel. The complimentary shuttle service to/from the airport was prompt and handy. A satisfactory continental breakfast in the morning was quite welcome. Location of the hotel was ok with quite a few eatries within walking distance. Overall a good experience and would recommend to those in need of overnight 
accommodation close to the airport.

review.title: Friendly with amenities
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, easy parking, great amenities. Clean room.  Wanted to stay close the airport to catch an early morning flight. The room was perfect for that scenario.

review.title: Nice hotel near Airport
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure what to expect for the price.  I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and nice staff.  Even though I wouldn't walk around the neighborhood at night there is enough with in driving distance including a mall.  We traveled to Napa and down to Pebble Beach and Carmel by the Sea so this hotel worked great for what we were looking for.

review.title: One night stopover stay
review.reviewText: For a one-night stopover, the shuttle transfer to and from the airport was good and the room was comfortable. Slightly noisy, but I was trying to sleep at 7pm ready for a 4am wake-up call. There were several restaurants and bars nearby too - good value for money all round.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: This is exactly what I expected for a two star hotel.  Basic and clean hotel.  The front desk and maintenance staff are awesome. Had a problem with our shower and it was fixed in about twenty minutes.

review.contentCodes: CRMD REMOD CSN NLI HMP MMD
review.title: waiting to get my money back
review.reviewText: room was dirty, blood splatter on the walls, need I say anything else

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for your review. We are so proud of our hardworking staff and are very happy to hear they took great care of you. We appreciate your business and hope you will be back to stay with us in the future. Thank you for making Days Inn your choice for a San Francisco Airport Hotel

review.reviewText: Good clean basic hotel, free airport shuttle. Breakfast buffet was very good and staff extremely helpful.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for all of your positive feedback. We would like to sincerely apologize for the misinformation you were given regarding our hotel shuttle, which does only transport guests between the airport and hotel. We will make sure to discuss the issue with our staff and so we can ensure only correct information is given in the future. We look forward to your next visit and appreciate you giving us another chance. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Days Inn San Francisco International Airport West.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: We originally only booked it because the hotel staff told us they had a shuttle that lead directly to the piers of san Francisco, when we arrived at the hotel come to find out, the person we originally talked to was wrong and they didn't have the shuttle. Although this was a huge disappointment we decided to stay anyways. The staff was very friendly and gave us helpful tips while touring in san Francisco. The room was clean and the beds comfy so we even booked an extra night. Would stay here again if need be and the only reason for my for star rating is because of the misinformation in the beginning.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you very much for your review. We are so happy to hear that your stay went well and hope your soccer tournament was a success too!! We do apologize for the issues with the internet and are currently looking into the best solution option so our guests will not have any problems in the future. We appreciate your business and hope you will continue to stay with us in the future. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Days Inn San Francisco International Airport West.

review.title: Soccer tournent
review.reviewText: Everything was good. Quiet, clean and friendly staff.  Only issue was the WiFi was not very strong. Daughter was not able to work on homework in the evening.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you for the positive feedback. We are happy to hear you were comfortable and were taken care of by our staff. We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next visit. Thank you for making Days Inn your choice for a San Francisco Airport Hotel.

review.title: Good value near SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room and excellent staff.   We will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to airport, complimentary shuttle, very comfortable bed,  exceptionally helpful staff.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
Thank you so much for the five star review. We love hearing positive feedback about our staff and really appreciate you leaving the review especially since it wasn't your direct experience. We hope you will continue to stay with us in the future. Thank you for making Days Inn your choice for a San Francisco Airport Hotel.

review.title: Place to crash
review.reviewText: While I was waiting to check in I happen to hear the conversation between the front desk clerk and elderly couple. The clerk was so very helpful and very nice. 5 star for customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Unfortunately did not check around, we came in SF due to death in the family

managementResponses.response:

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly fine for what it is. Clean room. Nice staff. Easy to get to from the airpot. Lots of Uber and Lyft options available. Typical motel breakfast.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for your review. We are glad your stay was satisfactory and hope you will book with us in the future. Thank you for making Days Inn your choice for a San Francisco Airport Hotel.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Not the best but was everything I expected. No surprises either way!

managementResponses.response:

We are happy to hear your actual stay was satisfactory and hope you will be back to stay with us in the future. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Days Inn San Francisco International Airport West.

review.title: Expedia had it labeled wrong on my conformation.
review.reviewText:
My conformation shows that the hotel is in "Burlingame" (granted in much smaller type it does say San Bruno, I can provide a copy of my conformation). I watched many buses come by for hotels in Burlingame. After about 1.5 hours I called again and asked when the "Burlingame" bus would arrive and they said it was in San Bruno. I had missed the San Bruno bus at least twice. I do not think this is the fault of the hotel. 

The hotel is older, but it was comfortable, the wi-fi fast and the breakfast adequate. 

If the picture of the hotel is actually the hotel then I didn't see it.
review.negativeRemarks: Much in my room seemed out of date, but in very good condition. The Wi-Fi was flawless and the bed very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Pizza right across the street as well as many other restaurants.

review.title: please don't bother if sleep is on your mind.
review.reviewText: This hotel has to much noise from roadway traffic, you sound like your sleeping on the curb.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport and easy to get around
review.reviewText: Nice and reasonable priced hotel near airport and easy to jump on all the highways to get you in and out of downtown San Francisco.  The rooms were big, but the walls are thin.  So, you can hear people in your next rooms.  However, the hotel is very, very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing of walls.
review.locationRemarks: Near to airport and close to the highway

review.reviewText: It was a very convinient hotel to stay before our fly early in the morning. It is surrounded by many restaurants and gas stations and very close drive to the airport.

review.title: Good location, low price
review.reviewText: Very convenient location near restaurants, shopping, airport, etc.  Room clean and serviced daily, pleasant staff, free wi-fi, breakfast items.
It was what we expected and needed. Inexpensive and close to airport for last night in San Francisco.
We were given a handicapped room, but didn't need one. The bathroom had no counters for toiletries and the shower floor was very slippery. The breakfast buffet was minimal.

review.title: Layover in San Francisco
review.reviewText: After returning to the U.S. from a 3 week trip to Asia, I had to overnight in San Francisco before heading home to Denver.  I picked this hotel because it is very close to the airport and had a courtesy shuttle.  The overall experience was very pleasant.  The shower was hot, the bed was soft, and there was no noise from any adjoining room.  They also have a complimentary breakfast that was quite good.  If you are looking for a fairly cheap and reasonable place to stay while passing thru SFO, I highly recommend staying here.
review.locationRemarks: There is not a whole lot of choices for dining nearby, but the pizza parlor across the street named Zorba's is really good and fairly cheap.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Clean enough.  Rooms slightly worn.  Staff friendly.  Stayed one night before leaving San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Good overnight hotel.
review.reviewText: I would not stay for an extended stay but certainly good for a pleasant overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Minor updating needed.
review.locationRemarks: On main drive, lots of places to eat or drink near by.

review.title: Excellent overnight stay hotel
review.reviewText:
The owners are very accommodating. Let s check in at 12:30 and gave us late check out 1pm.
Walking distance to stores and restaurants. Very nice family hotel. Will stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Free awesome breakfast and free wifi and great location
review.negativeRemarks: Carpeting in hallways needs restoration. Rooms have been renovated.
review.locationRemarks: 10 min from SFO. Zorbas Italian restaurant across the street has great pizza.

review.title: Reasonably priced hotel near airport
review.reviewText: I chose Days Inn because of the price.  I have a limited budget, but was surprised at how nice it was!  Firstly, it's close to the airport and has a FREE shuttle back and forth, so that was a nice perk.  From 6a-9a, a 'make your own' waffle bar was available (regular and blueberry batter), as well as 2 different kinds of cold cereals, freshly-made hot oatmeal with toppings (raisins, granola & brown sugar), 3 different kinds of breads for toasting with jam/jelly spreads & butter and refrigerated yogurt cups & cheese omelets for reheating in microwave.  There was also OJ, apple juice and plenty of fresh, hot brewed coffee, regular & decaf.  No need to go ANYWHERE for breakfast!  Also, in the sitting room, there is a computer for printing out your boarding pass.  Convenient!  The decor could use some updating, but it didn't affect my 3-night stay there.  In the room, there was cable TV, WiFi, a microwave, small fridge and plenty of hot water (good pressure too).  The best part of my stay without question?  THE BED!  OMG...my double bed was so comfortable, it felt like I was sleeping on a cloud.  Seriously!  I am used to an extra firm bed for my back, but once I got in the bed, it just surrounded me in softness and within minutes, I was OUT!  I discovered that the mattress was a Beautyrest Pillowtop, made by Simmons.  I am SO SPOILED now, that I have to buy the same kind of bed for my apartment.  Geez...thanks a lot Days Inn!!   I highly recommend this hotel :)

review.title: It was very nice
review.reviewText: I was stuct at SFO and pick a cheap hotel for 5hours sleep. This was nicer then expected.

review.title: We arrived very late after a long travel
review.reviewText:
The shuttle bus came promptly
The staff at the hotel were very friendly courteous helpful

review.title: Simple hotel with free airport shuttle service
review.reviewText: Clean, no-frills hotel. Nothing special, but quite satisfactory.

There are so many things wrong with this hotel I don't even know where to begin. I suppose I should begin with the moment you walk in the door. The lobby smells of a fusion of curry, body odor, cheap perfume and cigarettes. I dreaded everytime I had to suffer through the smell to and from my room. At some points of the day the smell is bad enough to make your nose bleed.
Once you do finally escape the odors of the lobby you will be greeted by a room with the bare necessities. There were ants all over the bath room from the moment I arrived. The first night the toilet clogged after I urinated. I called the front desk asking if I could grab a plunger. First off, I should not have to plunge a toilet that I clearly did not clog. Secondly, the front desk said they would, "call me back or bring a plunger to the room." Well, I never received a call back nor a visit. By the next morning my whole room smelt like a port o potty. After a second call in the AM, a receptionist kindly brought up a plunger to my room. I easily unclogged the toilet but still, I did not pay to unclog someone else's #2. 
The walls are paper thin. The first night I was kept up late by the adjacent rooms TV. The second was quiet as there were no occupants. By the third night there was a family of at least five in the room next door. Yet again I was kept up late because of the sounds of talking, laughing and stomping. As if the noise from the room next store was not enough, you have to constantly deal with the so

review.title: Inn close to SFO
review.reviewText: We stayed at this inn as the last stop of our road trip. We reserved for a room with king-sized bed, but because of overbooking we got a two-bed room instead. Everything in the room was okay. The wifi was not very fast and not good for video streaming. One problem we had was that the walls seemed to be thin. A couple was arguing next door and we could hear every single word of it. The breakfast is served from 6am to 9am so be sure to get to the breakfast area early enough.

review.title: Close to SFO airport
review.reviewText:
Good hotel; clean, efficient staff, comfortable.  It is less than ten minutes from the San Francisco airport and has a reliable courtesy van. 

There are good Chinese and Italian restaurants within a block.

review.title: close  to airport
review.reviewText: clean and comfy but need some updating.  Parking is terrible breakfast was ok but nothing special.  for the price it was an ok place to stay.

review.title: Hotel is great No Parking
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice.  However, there was very little parking, and we had to park on the street.

Stayed two nights, one beginning a flight out of SFO and one upon returning. Nice comfortable rooms. Francis was working and gave us and another bottled water when the machine was out on the first night. Forgot toothbrush/paste and received a set  at the front. Very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, clean, good parking, tv/fridge, friendly helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Jacuzzi tub had a slow drain.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: A very Good stay
review.reviewText: Excellent food service near Hotel and comfortable  to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Good surrounding services

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at this place. Simple and no fuzz that takes care of my needs.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Easy to airport. Plenty for breakfast and very helpful staff

review.title: What was going on in the room next door??!?
review.reviewText: The hotel's location was great. The room was clean (ish) but the staff was nice. Biggest complaint was the uncomfortable bed and the crazy neighbors next door. They had the tv going and aparently WAY more fun than us at 2 in the morning. We were that boring couple trying to get some sleep before our 6 am flight. They were not. The breakfast was fine. The shower was clean. It's close to the airport.

review.title: Good hotel if you need to take a flight next day.
review.reviewText: Good place to stay for a night clean comfortable and not expensive. Nice staff at front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport good breakfast and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Because it's close to the airport you ear airplane all night.
review.locationRemarks: Very good family restaurant across the street wich serves italian and greek food.

review.title: Good deal for travelers flying in and out of SF
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night on my way through SF for a concert downtown. Complimentary airport shuttle was very convenient. Within walking distance of a handful of bars and places to eat. Room appeared clean although dated, as there were old stains all over the carpets. Hotel staff was very friendly. If you're looking to do something in the city, I would recommend researching the public transportation system ahead of time (if you don't have a car). Was pressed for time upon getting checked in and found out there are no BART stations nearby. The cab ride to downtown SF was very spendy. I was able to take the BART back after the concert when I was no longer pressed for time, but I still had to walk over 2 miles to get back to the hotel from the closest station. As the hotel is located on a major street (El Camino Real), the traffic noise in the morning was highly noticeable. But overall a nice, affordable hotel and I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary airport shuttle, affordable, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets could be deep-cleaned
review.locationRemarks: Bars and eateries nearby, but BART station a good walk away (maybe MUNI stops closer?)

review.title: Serviceable hotel close to airport at cheap rate.
review.reviewText: Basic hotel.  Helpful staff and nice to have a breakfast included at this price.

review.title: Convenient, comfortable
review.reviewText: It's very close to the airport, with a shuttle to make the short trip. The rooms are surprisingly large and comfortable, though the air conditioner make a bit of a noise, so I'm glad I didn't have to use it.

review.title: Skeevy hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Enough said ...  I feared I would get bitten by bedbugs
Good location, clean and free parking.  Nothing fancy and average customer service at front desk

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect for my one night.  I would call it adequate.  It is not the worst nor the best. Rooms were clean and the staff was great.  The airport shuttle was slow in comparison to some of the other hotels in the area
WE ARRIVED ABOUT 11:00 IN THE EVENING AND LEFT ON THE SHUTTLE AT 4:30 THE NEXT MORNING, SO OUR STAY WAS SHORT.   NO COMPLAINTS ON THE ROOM OR THE SERVICE.

review.title: A great place to stay near the ariport
review.reviewText: This is a friendly , clean and well kept facility, very neat the airport. The breakfasts are a nice touch, as is free parkingh.

review.title: too noisey
review.reviewText: Nick was great, he answered all my questions  I have no other feelings about the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: noise

review.title: Easy access to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel has easy access to the airport but it is 5km away from the airport.  We drove to the hotel,  dropped off our luggage in our room,  then drove out to the airport to return our rental car.  We used the free hotel shuttle to get back to the hotel.  Very easy.  Nice pizza restaurant opposite the hotel

review.title: ..then there was the smell
review.reviewText: A rank odor greeted our family upon our arrival.  Check in was 4pm, which meant that we had to wait in the tiny reception area adjoining the tiny breakfast area where the housekeepers were heating and eating their lunches.  Food smells combined with the lobby's sour smell.  Floors, walls,  desk area...nothing looked clean.  Areas of linoleum were missing in the elevator's floor.  In our room, bedspreads were worn and soiled.  The smell was unpleasant. Room clock set minutes not hours;  small tv did not work;  and lobby computer would not connect to the Internet.   Because only a sidewalk separates the hotel from a busy street, sleep was elusive due to all night traffic noises to include big trucks and motorcycles,  The trash truck noisily came and went at 5:30 am just beneath our window.  During the seemingly endless night, we never adjusted to the room's pervasive, offensive odor.  I apologized to my family for making this reservation.
review.positiveRemarks: The sheets were clean, and the large bathroom was clean even though the bathroom wallpaper was peeling off.
review.negativeRemarks: Major renovations to include thorough cleaning need to be done.  Soundproofing would be welcome.
review.locationRemarks: The neighborhood is as run down as the hotel.  I did not feel safe as we finally found a pizza restaurant.  Many, many shops were out of business.

review.title: Pleasant weekend.
review.reviewText: The night reservation clerk was so knowledgeable and helped us in many ways: directions to the hotel, explaining maps, adjusting our room T.V., fixing the computer to print out our airline tickets, etc.  Although we did not need to deal with the day clerk much, when we did he was helpful and pleasant.  The maids were cheerful when filling our requests.  The parking was easy and ample.  Yes, we would definitely stay at Days Inn the next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Very good and economic accommodation.
review.reviewText:
Days Inn San Bruno was perfect for our 3 nights then 2 nights separated by 2 weeks driving rental car around CA.  Thirty minutes walk to BART at Milbrae. Or free shuttle to SFO airport with its BART station and rental cars etc. On local bus route. All the staff we met were extremely helpful. Rooms were comfortable and clean with only a slight niggle about typical American bathroom fittings, though of no real concern. We will certainly stay there again with its proximity to SFO airport when we next visit from New Zealand. 
Full marks to the shuttle driver who promptly circled back to SFO when my wife realised she had left a bag containing $1000 cash and credit cards at the pick up point after our 12 hr flight. It was still there! G.O.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location and value with free SFO shuttle. Bus to shops about a mile away near San Bruno BART for about a 30 min ride to SF City.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing of any concern to us.
review.locationRemarks: Good Italian restaurant across the road. Also Pancake house 5 mins walk away. Sears, J. C. Penny, Target, food hall etc a mile away with free parking.

review.title: Handy to airport and zorvas pizza
review.reviewText: Free parking, quick in and out.  Good pizza across the street

Perfect place to stay to fly out of SFO airport. Shuttle was on time.
Staff was friendly & informative.
Room was comfortable and very clean.would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of restaurants close by.

review.title: New car rental drop-off

review.title: Useful hotel

review.positiveRemarks: Good sized room, clean. Decent continental breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Room keys demagnetised easily
review.locationRemarks: Good for airport, easy to get in out from south and east over spectacular San Mateo bridge or to coast. A very useful base.

review.title: Day's Inn, San Bruno, CA
review.reviewText: Hotel is old and rather tired. Bathroom facilities not up to today' standards. Breakfast a bit rudimentary compared to similar standard hotels. Staff were helpful and did their best with anything we asked.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Weren't there long enough to explore the "near by". Location is rather farther from the airport than we expected, but not too bad.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: The location is clean and comformtable, with free parking, wifi, breakfast, and close to the airport.  The staff are nice and helpful.  The location is old and tired looking, but overall very good value for your money, in a very expensive city.

review.title: Did not look at all like the photos.
review.reviewText: ok because only stayed for a night. Old decor and not the cleanest.  Staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: update and clean the rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel; very convenient for getting to the airport. Breakfast provided.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: We needed a place for one night while breaking up a flight from Kauai to Cincy. The hotel staff was friendly and efficient.  The shuttle to and from the airport all worked out well. The breakfast was good enough to fuel us up for the rest of the flight. The room cleanliness wasn't so great. It's the only thing that we would've expected more from for the relatively low price place.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff. Shuttle to and from airport. Price.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness. Better breakfast options.
review.locationRemarks: Airport.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: This is an older property, but the rooms are clean, there is excellent free wifi, free parking, and the rooms have a microwave and small fridge.  The location is good too, close to public transport, and close to the airport.  I stay here often because it has what I need and the price is great for the San Francisco area.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, wifi, parking, close to amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: BART to downtown San Francisco is close by (20-30 minutes walking distance).

review.title: Good hotel, close to the airport
review.reviewText:
I liked the free off street parking and the staff was very nice.  The free breakfast was okay.  You can make waffles, but sometimes it took a while to get done as there was only one waffle maker and lots of people.  WE also had a room right next to the laundry room and we did not hear a thing.  The pillows were amazing.

What I did not like was the fact that the beds were too firm for my liking.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants nearby from Chinese food to pizza.  Grocery store, Catholic Church and CVS pharmacy about a mile to the south.

review.title: Good Choicefor Early Flights Out
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine for what we needed.  we were there less than 6 hours at the end of a Napa trip as somewhere to stay close to the airport since we were leaving really early.  I would not book this hotel as a place to stay for more than a night.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk open 24 hours, close to airport (especially car rental return).
review.negativeRemarks: Could use new counter in bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.reviewText: staff went above and beyond, very helpful. Staff made sure we were taken care of from the time we checked in to the time we left.  Helped in turning if car at airport and made sure we got back to hotel.

review.title: Good hotel Near The Airport
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel that is located near the airport. Good size for our family of floor, clean, and excellent customer service at the front desk. The only drawback I see is it is pretty pricey, but when comparing it to other hotels in San Francisco it ends up being pretty competitive
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room and excellent Customer Service
review.negativeRemarks: Be a more competitive with your pricing. This is a Days Inn not the Four Seasons
review.locationRemarks: The location is about a mile from the airport

review.title: Clean and comfy.
review.reviewText: I stay often. It's clean, comfortable, close to the BART, free breakfast, free parking, free internet, and it's affordable in an expensive town.

review.title: Dingy motel
review.reviewText:
The *only* positive, this motel is close the airport, which we needed for our early flight. 
The on-staff manager at check-in was friendly, but as soon as the elevator door opened at our floor, we saw the stained hallway carpet. 
Our room was worse. The room was dingy and dark. The bed linens were clean looking, but ragged. The bathroom was clean, but the overall creapy feeling of the room overshadowed the clean bathroom. The street was busy and loud. We finally fell asleep, only to wake to a previously set alarm, at 2:15 am.
The room was overpriced for this experience.

review.title: you get what you pay.
review.reviewText: This is Day Inn, two star hotel. It is a decent, comfortable place to stay, and breakfast is included.Try to request for the rear rooms since the front facing the main street. The traffic may bother you if you are a light sleeper.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk is very accommodating. The manager is a very understanding person. Breakfast has a lots of varieties.
review.negativeRemarks: The potpourri smell are too strong in the lobby and hall ways. The shrieking noise of the exhaust fans in the bathroom are too loud.
review.locationRemarks: There are some small restaurants around. Not much to do around the area.

review.title: Near beach n Frisco zoo :)
review.reviewText: It was clean , good service , breakfast , and condition of the whole hotel

We asked the lady that checked us in if she would give us a 3:30am wake up call in the morning since we had an early flight out of San Francisco the next day, she said sure. That evening we touched base with another person at the front desk and reminded them that we had a 3:30am wake up call. He said we have you down for a 3:30am wake up call. We did not receive the wake up call. Luckily we had set the alarm on our phone and the alarm in our room. Also every time we went by the front desk no one was there, rang the bell and it might take 2-3 minutes for anyone to show up. Horrible hotel stay.

review.title: Great location, comfortable

I felt the parking lot was safe for my vehicle which was a large concern of mine. I thought the beds were comfortable, room was clean, gentlemen at the front desk was awesome. I truly cannot complain about this location. I really liked how right across the street, there was an amazing pizza joint too! Super convenient. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Was just what I needed.
review.reviewText: My Days Inn experience was absolutely top notch. I arrived in San Francisco after having a very stressful and sleep-deprived night. I was also preparing for a week-long conference that I knew would tire me out further. The staff at the Days Inn made my stay (and my week) monumentally better. The front desk staff were efficient and helpful at check-in and check-out, they had toothpaste for me when I realized I had forgotten my own, and they were so professional when the power went out in San Bruno for over an hour. I honestly cannot say enough nice things about this establishment.

review.title: Inconvenient to airport
review.reviewText:
Nothing wrong with this place as a motel, but a disappointment regarding convenience to the SFO airport.
I booked a room there the night before our 7am flight the next day. I expected this would allow us to get up
around 5:30 to take the complimentary shuttle to be there by 6am. To my unpleasant surprise the shuttle
left only on the hour, so we had to get up at 4:30am to get on the 5:00am shuttle which was seriously
overcrowded and took almost an hour to get to our terminal. We could have stayed in the city and taken
BART or a cab for a lot less money than the room cost.

review.title: The Definition of Good Service
review.reviewText:
We decided to book close to the airport due to an early flight. Not having the exact address handy we had a bit of a tense ride finding the hotel as it was not on our taxi drivers radar. With some trepidation on arrival I was greated with a friendly, warm reassuring Yes!! You are in the right place. We were checked in quickly, found our rooms easily and settled in for a night packing and prep for the mornings trip home. Having been warned on our outgoing flight that our bags were slightly overweight we wanted to be sure that we didn't have the same problem heading home. No problem, they had a weight scale we could use and it worked.
Dinner recommendations were excellent and we enjoyed a good dinner, close by. The next morning the shuttle got us to the airport without a hitch and the homeward bound trip went off without a hitch.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff, welcoming environment, proximity to restaurants, cleanliness

Found a pleasant Szechuan style Chinese restaurant about two blocks north on the other side of the boulevard. I left before 6 for an early flight so did not get a chance to try the breakfast.

review.title: Been before & chose to return.

review.title: A Decent place to stay
review.reviewText:
They remodeled some of the rooms since our last stay. The first room we were given had some issues regarding the shower. The manager immediately set us up with another room when we brought it to his attention. The second room also had some minor issues, like dresser drawers were difficult to open, a missing bathroom door hook for the robe, loose faucet handles.... I gave the manager the list when we checked out so that his staff could take care of it before the next guest's arrival. I felt that those issues should have been monitored by the cleaning staff. They should have been aware of these when they were cleaning the room.

They should shampoo or steam clean the carpet on a regular basis. I was walking around in my white socks on the first day and they were "blacken" at the bottom when I removed them. Fortunately, I packed my slippers so only 1 pair of socks got the worst of it and I washed my slippers before re-packing them. Also, a few days later, my wife misplaced her ring on the new room and I was on my hands and knees looking for it. I found it but also felt how "soiled" the carpet was.

I suggest a checklist for the cleaning staff to ensure things are in good working condition prior to the guest's stay. Also, the management staff can conduct random quality control inspections.
review.positiveRemarks: Belgium Waffle maker, hard boiled eggs and fresh fruits.
review.negativeRemarks: Mostly Carbs for breakfast. Carpet needs shampoo or steam cleaning.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Didn't live up to billing as convenient SFO hotel
review.reviewText: Very disappointing experience. Hotel was grim and the staff not helpful. The hotel advertised their free airport shuttle, but don't tell you it only runs once per hour and visits multiple hotels before going to SFO. I had to be a the airport at 6:am and the desk clerk said I would have to leave at 5:00! I had to pay for a cab, that they promised to call for me and then forgot. Avoid this property.

review.title: Bad even by airport hotel standards
review.reviewText: While not luxury, you expect a basic level with the Days Inn chain. The best thing I can say is that there were no cigarette burns on the bedspread. It took 2 visits to the desk to get our key to work. The room had an overpowering disinfectant smell like the previous occupant had smoked or maybe someone had died in the room. It is on a busy street and the windows are obviously not insulated so it is very noisy. At breakfast they were out of stuff plus they had Fox News playing loudly on the TV.

review.title: Should have looked around more. There are more.

review.positiveRemarks: The free parking was the highlight.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs some renovation.could use a friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: You can not beat the location.it was a short thirty minutes to downtown. The highway was right down the street. A GPS and good parking garage .

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: The price was affordable compared to other hotels. However, it is an older hotel, with smaller rooms, even smaller because the microwave and small refrigerator takes up what little space there is. The queen bed next to the window is 12" away from the wall which gives you some idea about the tight quarters. The breakfast buffet is minimal with no eggs or sausage, something that was available in the three other hotels we stayed during our recent trip to California. The good points is that is about 1.5 miles away from the Millbrae BART and CalTrain station which is a very convient way to get into San Francisco as we did the one night we stayed there to see a SF Giants game. It is also located close to the SF airport. It's not a bad place to stay for one night.....but for us, if we visited this area again, I would see what else is available in the same price range.

review.title: Disappointing..many nicer hotels nearby.
review.reviewText: The shuttle driver was less than friendly. When we got to the hotel, we were disappointed by the conditions. We had stayed at the Dylan down the street on the front end of our trip, and wished we could go back there. The rooms are old and dated, and dirty feeling. On the website it says "Relax in our hot tub.."...there is no hot tub. When we asked the desk clerk about it, he said they did have jacuzzi tubs in some rooms and we could have one for an additional charge. We were very disappointed with this, as the key thing that drew us to this hotel was being able to relax in the hot tub after a long week. I would not return to this hotel, or recommend it to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel needs a room renovation in a bad way.

review.title: It was close to the airport and highways
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the area, did not spend much time in the hotel but it was centrally located for what we wanted to go see, close to highway 101 which let us go downtown, Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate Brige easy enough.
review.negativeRemarks: It could have been a little cleaner, socks were dirty from walking around, did not have a pool or exercise room which we wanted.
review.locationRemarks: it was close to nearly everything,,,highway 101 made it easy to go to the wharf, the bridge, and downtown to sites.

review.title: Ok hotel on main road

review.title: Adequate hotel for a night's stay

The staff are very quick to close down the breakfast facility dead on 09:00. at 1 minute past 9 I had to ask for some fruit!!

The location to the airport and cost were this hotel's saving grace.

review.title: Get what you pay for...

review.title: It's olkay
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean. However, I could hear planes landing and taking off all night; the next morning the desk clerk said I "had one of the more quiet rooms"????? The shuttle from the airport was "spotty". The first time around, the shuttle didn't stop at United Airlines, just went past, not slowing down. The second one, did stop but the wait from my arrival at the shuttle stop to the hotel ending up being over an hour. I was exhausted anyway having just arrived from Barcelona.

review.title: Comfortable for a family stay.
review.reviewText: We stayed several nights. We asked for a room towards the back because we wanted quiet, away from traffic noise. The hotel is well located in a neighborhood setting with restaurants and stores close by. For a near-the-airport-and-shuttle service I would recommend it.

review.title: Breakfast is very basic.

The next morning the shuttle took me back to the airport so i could get the Bart underground to the train for my trip. I would recommend this hotel based on price and the shuttle for overnight stops to and from the airport only.
review.negativeRemarks: Stained carpets and rundown furniture

Staff was exceptionally nice in being flexible in allowing us to use the lobby to prepare for a demo the morning before our stay -- appreciated their niceness. Another good point was the location was conveniently close to SFO -- making it easy to head over to the airport for a very early morning flight.

review.title: Perfect place if leaving on an early flight

review.title: Great hotel for a quick stop over for the airport
