review.title: Grear hotel for night before traveling
review.reviewText: I just booked the hotel for a night before traveling back. It was close to the airport and the complimentary shuttle worked nicely. There is also a cheap pizza place accross the street that makes great pizzas and has very good service.
review.positiveRemarks: great location close to airport and complimentary shuttle

review.title: Great hotel for budget travel!!!
review.reviewText: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay for the weekend. This hotel met and exceeded my expectations for the price. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and Kishan the desk clerk was friendly and answered questions with a smile. Housekeeping was good, and they too were nice and friendly. Located away from the hustle of the city but close enough to drive and enjoy the city. Orange juice at breakfast was great. Wifi worked well. Very close to SFO airport. Only minor complaints, the parking is very limited if you get in late, the shower curtain was way too short, and the carpet in the halls can stand replacing, but carpet in rooms was clean. Looking for an affordable clean place to sleep, this is your place. This is not a new hotel but clean. I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Kishan, the desk clerk, was friendly and very helpful. He was there the money we left to go out and was still smiling that night when we came back.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking on one night we came in late, but you can park on the street if getting up prior to 6am.No parking on street during day hours. Get in early
review.locationRemarks: Airport is very close and easily accessible. Just outside the hustle of downtown San Francisco but close enough to appreciate the short distance.

review.title: Great Overnighter
review.reviewText: met request for quieter room away from main road traffic.Great proximity to airport and major transportation systems. many good restaurants within suitable walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Highway and air traffic noise
review.locationRemarks: perfect for overnight flight transits

review.title: Good Quality Given Price
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel due to arriving late to San Francisco and not wanting to have to travel into Union Square at that time.
Given the price we paid we didn't expect it to be amazing. We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel.
The customer service was excellent and they were more than happy to be of help even at the late hour we arrived.
The room was clean and a good size. The shower was excellent. Good pressure. Pillows a little lumpy and thin and there was an issue with the air con where it wouldn't stay on.
Having said that they have a complimentary, help yourself breakfast service and they had a complimentary airport shuttle that runs every hour. Couldn't have been happier given what we paid.
review.positiveRemarks: Couldn't have asked for more given the price paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows

review.title: Generally good, but with disappointing aspects
review.reviewText: The hotel was generally well kept and the car parking facilities were convenient. The desk service, breakfast and aIrport shuttle were also good. The let-down was the condition of the room we stayed in; it had been cleaned that day, but it was basically not well-maintained. The paint was peeling on the bathroom door and there were holes in the bedspread and the blanket... I mean large holes. They could have originated as cigarette burns (but why so in a non-smoking room?); but they spoiled the impression and should have been replaced.
review.negativeRemarks: condition of bathroom paintwork and bedding
review.locationRemarks: close to San Francisco airport and surrounded by eating establishments

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: bathrooms are in need of upgrading otherwise satisfactory for short term stay
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to airport and transportation to city
review.negativeRemarks: outdated bathroom
review.locationRemarks: very good

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely room, staff friendly and helpful. Shuttle bus service excellent. Value for money, would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Great for the airport. No decent restaurants within walking distance - only fast food places.

review.title: Nice for free shuttle
review.reviewText: Very restless night d/t noise from next room and hallway. Not the worst hotel ever but wouldn't stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Can hear noise from other rooms/hallways

review.title: Vroom Vroom!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a decent night stay. You get what you pay for and for what we paid, this was as expected. For being extremely affordable, you can't expect the fine finishes of a luxury hotel. Some areas looked a little run down, but our rooms were clean. The hotel staff was exceptionally accommodating and the hotel is conveniently located to the airport. We did have a street side room which was quite noisy with the sounds of traffic during the day but it didn't keep me up at night. I think next time I would request an interior room rather than street-side.
review.negativeRemarks: Road noise
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Days Inn SFO airport
review.reviewText: The best Days Inn I have ever stayed. Close to rental car return and the airport. My only complaint is that the shuttle only once an hour, although I did not use it.
review.negativeRemarks: poor WiFi connection
review.locationRemarks: SFO airport

review.title: Days Inn
review.reviewText: For it's price it was a nice hotel. I would go again.
review.positiveRemarks: They had an extra pillow in the dresser. YEAH! The bed and air conditioning was great. Loved the soft fluffy pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: The not easy closing bathroom door and the slaming main room door. They might have been able to fix if we had asked. It was not a big deal for us.
review.locationRemarks: About 1 mile up the street north from Millbrae Bart Station.

review.title: Room quality lacking, friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: Hotel felt a bit seedy, though staff was very nice and helpful and they do have a free shuttle to the airport. Shower curtain was too small to fit the shower, the curtain rod was falling off the wall. Wall paper in the rooms and bathroom was sagging off the wall. A/C had a thermostat on the wall which didn't work, controls on the old style unit itself were functional.

review.title: it was ok.
review.reviewText: I wasnt there very long,got there around 10pm& had to catch an early flight out. The taxi driver had a very hard time finding the hotel because the road changes into another city right before this hotel...very confusing/long/and $$$ taxi ride. When finally got there, went to sleep & was awakened by a person screaming at someone on the other side of the wall.. it was 1:30am and from all the door slamming,I think they had just arrived...was wondering if it was the last room in the hotel or just a bad judgement call that the staff had made putting these people who arrived at 1:30 am right beside me! They continued to slam doors and talk loudly waking me up several times until I finally had to get up at 4:30 to catch my airport shuttle. It was a pretty miserable nights sleep. The guy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful which was pretty much the highlight of this hotel stay.

review.title: Hakan from Turkey
review.reviewText: The only problem was,(air condition) heating in room 217 doesn't work.The guy in the front desk was very helpfull.He tried twice but didin't work.At the end he gave us a small heater because it was too cold for us.Other than that I recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: days inn san bruno, ca
review.reviewText: good price for a clean hotel with good service....

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Convenient to SFO. We were passing through from Hawaii, arriving late at night and getting up early for a flight to Georgia. Staff was most accommodating. Free shuttle service both ways.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Ok budget hotel. There was no one on front desk when we arrived, but then it was 2am. Therefore we did not get to really interact with any staff

review.title: decent..
review.reviewText: Small room but worked great since we had an early flight the next morning. Nothing fancy but you get what you pay for.
review.negativeRemarks: Small breakfast

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay, the lobby was so welcoming and the staff was friendly and efficient. Although they're under remodeling, it was clean and not noisy at all. The airport is just behind the hotel, but you didn't hear the noise of planes. Looking forward in staying there again in the future if I need to be in the area again.
review.positiveRemarks: Refrigerator and microwave was a plus for me. A very quiet stay. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance, lots to choose from.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located central to everything. Business, shopping, drs. Airport and more.

review.title: enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: enjoyed our stay.. perfect for when you are catching a flight out and just have a couple of days to stay in san fran to see the sights.. room was comfortable and since we only spent our nights there , it was perfect....

review.title: Good for overnight flight connections
review.reviewText:
This is a good place to stay overnight when making overseas connections. I was pleased with it in Feb and so stayed again this month and was equally pleased.

The room was clean and adequate. To get the "complimentary" shuttle from the airport, you need to phone them for a pick-up. The driver expected a tip and tried to demand one. He was displeased when I told him that the shuttle was supposed to be complimentary.

There is a nice pizza place across the street, but it closes early.

I would not stay there if visiting San Francisco, because it is too far from town.

review.title: Not Recommended
review.reviewText: The facility is very rundown. The coffee in the breakfast room was atrocious! The bananas were turning black and there was no other fruit. We left the rooms at 8:30 A.M. and didn't return till 3:30 or 4:00 P.M. and the rooms were not cleaned yet. We had to wait.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: There's a saying, "You get what you pay for." The hotel was not what we expected. In general, the hotel needs an overall updating - rooms, lobby, breakfast area (was very congested and not kept clean), furniture (poor and unclean). The hotel does offer free shuttle to and from SFO, which is nice. They also offer free Wi-Fi, which is also nice. Would we stay here again? Very likely not, unless there were no other options. Front Desk staff were very nice and helpful. We cannot complain with them. Cleanliness and poor condition of the hotel in general would be our main complaint. On the hotel's behalf, they were doing some minor updates during our stay. Kuddos to them but I don't see an end. It needs a complete over-haul. The location of the hotel is another downfall. It appeared to be in a very busy and questionable area.
review.positiveRemarks: Free SFO Shuttle and Free Wi-Fi Service
review.negativeRemarks: Location and General Condition and Cleanliness -- we expected better.
review.locationRemarks: Very busy street in San Bruno. We were not comfortable going out and about in this area.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: nice and clean, close to airport and they offer a shuttle to pick you up.

review.title: near airport
review.reviewText: Just a 15 minute complimentary shuttle ride to ad from hotel makes this place worth it. Zorba's, just across the street, really does have the best pizza on the peninsula as they advertise.

review.title: OK for overnight
review.reviewText:
The hotel is good for spending the night for a flight. Nothing outstanding but OK.
The breakfast was not well stocked. When I went down to eat at 8:35 am there was no waffle mix and they did not refill it.
The shuttle worked out great though and that's what I wanted.

review.title: Good place to stay in San Francisco if you drive
review.reviewText: Easy to drive to downtown. The room was clean, all amenities in working condition. Good place. Will use it again.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin pillows as usual
review.locationRemarks: Easy to drive to downtown

review.title: Acceptable but not outstanding
review.reviewText: The hotel was well located for the airport and there are a number of bars and restaurants within walking distance. The man at the front desk was friendly and helpful although they were unable to manage anything more than a banana for breakfast for a departure before 6am. My room was slightly tired in appearance and not cleaned as well as I'd have expected. I wouldn't say it was dirty but there was certainly dust around and it didn't feel particularly fresh and clean. There was also a little bit of noise from the road at the front. The hotel was certainly acceptable for the price paid but I didn't leave feeling that I'd got an outstanding deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for San Francisco airport
review.negativeRemarks: Not as spotlessly clean as some other hotels I've visited in the States
review.locationRemarks: About 5 - 10 minutes drive from San Francisco airport, within walking distance of shops, bars and restaurants.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Required a 1 night stay before flying to san diego. Excellent location from airport. Great value.

review.title: Reasonable, so overlooked a few items
review.reviewText: Room and general condition of the building were acceptable. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Continental breakfast was as expected with cereal, waffles, coffee, etc. Room seemed mostly clean, updated and in generally good order. The mirror in our room was crooked and I couldn't adjust it. There was some hair on the bathroom floor and what looked like a couple of drops of coffee on the wall, doors needed to be cleaned, they looked grimy. For the money, it was a good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: cost, coffee in room, continental breakfast (basic, but convenient).
review.negativeRemarks: Some cleanliness issues, door to bathroom was really grimy, mirror in room hung crooked, hairs on floor of bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to access. close to airport, airport shuttle.

review.title: Very nice, inexpensive hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel located in San Bruno which is close to SFO and the San Bruno BART station. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast consists of fruit, cereal, toast, muffins, waffles, coffee, milk, and juices. Rooms are starting to show their age, but were kept clean and maintained. Beds are comfortable and TV (and other electrical items) worked well. Rooms come standard with microwave oven and mini-fridge which is helpful as there are several excellent restaurants [Patio Filipino and Mi Tequila] in the area (leftovers) as well as a few convenience stores with grocery items. The Tanforan Mall (small, but it has most of the staples) is only a short bus trip away (San Bruno BART and Sam Trans bus terminal is also at one end of the mall) and there is a Kohls, Walgreens, and Office Depot all within walking distance. The hotel also offers a van shuttle that can pick you up and/or drop you off at SFO. In my opinion, this is the best of the Days Inn hotels in the San Francisco area. The BART trip into San Francisco proper only takes about an half hour and is amazingly inexpensive. Don't bother renting a car unless you plan extensive touring as parking is very expensive in the city (free at the hotel) and public transportation is cheap, reliable, and frequent. All in all, a very nice place which we will use in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location with many excellent restaurants, shopping, and superb public transportation within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle will only take you to and from the airport (not to the mall/BART which is just sllightly out of walking distance).
review.locationRemarks: You have got to try Patio Filipino for absolutely mouth-watering food at great prices and only a few minutes walk from the hotel. Mi Tequila too.

review.title: Decent for a one or two night stay.
review.reviewText: Decent place to stay for a one or two night stay. Room was clean and quite. Area is decent and quite a few places up and down the road to get a bite to eat.

review.title: Ideal SFO Airport
review.reviewText: The ideal airport hotel. Free shuttle and decent breakfast. Great staff. Close to airport. Amazingly quiet.

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel room had an awful smell, like candle wax and stale air with vanilla and cleaners. It would not dispel even with the window open the entire time. The bathroom floor was covered in a dirty film. The television got 2 channels... They charged extra for a room with 2 beds even though I paid the extra money for a second person. They wanted extra for a fold out bed too. The clerk gave me 3 sheets because there was no blanket for the fold out bed, even though we paid the extra money for the fold out bed. The breakfast was almost gone by 6:30 am.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: It was very conveniently close to the airport. The shuttle bus from the airport finishs at 12:30 mn, that should be informed in the website. I j just made it by 10 minutes before.
review.negativeRemarks: Small place to haver breakfast (very crowded)
review.locationRemarks: Fine

review.title: Pleasant short stay
review.reviewText:
I and my two sisters stayed here and everything went smoothly. The car pick-up from the airport went smoothly, as did the airport transfer the next day. We enjoyed the hotel breakfast, and it was the first time a hotel waffle machine had worked well for me in several years so that was a pleasant surprise.
Shower was delightful and beds comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: all ok
review.locationRemarks: very convenient to the airport

review.title: Great for the normal American.
review.reviewText: If you are looking to stay at the Ritz Carlton this is not the hotel for you. If you are not an extravagant traveler and looking for a clean hotel with nice facilities, pleasant staff looking to be of assistance, and a conveniant location this is the place for you. We stayed for four nights and felt very comfortable. Basic ammenities like blowdryer, coffee maker. microwave, and fridge are provided. I am highly recommending this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes form the SFO airport.

review.title: Great budget hotel
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, nice staff, clean rooms, quiet, close to airport.
What else do you need?
Also, it was dirt cheap, had free wireless and a free bus from and to the airport.
Excellent value.
Anyone else who you see whinging and griping needs to get a life, or stop being a snob, I have stayed in hotels all over the world at around the same price level, and this is in my top 5.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, but not too close, Staff very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, lots of fast food and other restaurants close.

review.title: Safe bet near SFO.
review.reviewText: Good place to stay when you're seeking someplace close to SFO. It's comfortable, clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. While it's not a 5 star hotel, it's solid value for your hard earned dollar.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great - next to SFO and there's a shuttle to and from SFO to the hotel.

review.title: Very pleasant
review.reviewText: We had two rooms for five of us. Huge beds, very comfortable and clean. The hotel shuttle took us to the BART station outside the airport - save $4 per person on the BART tickets. Breakfast was good, including waffles which we hadn't expected. The only down side to breakfast was for a hotel with family friendly connecting rooms we thought the dining room would have tables that could seat more than two people.

review.title: Better 'hood than expected
review.reviewText:
We were extremely pleased with this hotel. Location (having a rental car) was perfect for us to take a day trip South to Monterey as well as towards the city. Nearby restaurants (recommended by a sharp front desk Indian lady, I think last name was Khan) were a great bargain and of surprisingly good quality.
The room was comfortable, quiet and well kept. I would not hesitate a second to go there again.
review.locationRemarks: We liked the drive South on PCH: spectacular. And of course dowtown San Francisco, the Marina, Sausalito.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room and very convenient to the airport.

review.title: clean room nice building
review.reviewText: 20 minutes to Frisco ...40 miles to Silicone Valley .

review.title: OK to stay few nights..
review.reviewText: Near to the airport. Clean room.

review.title: joes trip to SFO
review.reviewText: see below

review.title: Days Inn San Bruno
review.reviewText:
Great Price. Free continental breakfast everyday. Breakfast consisted of coffee, toast and jams, waffles, fresh apples and banana.. Etc. There was no meat. Room was clean. I had trouble working the temperature control - not the hotel's fault. They clean around 5 pm which was different though we didn't mind. It was 30 min drive to Frisco which included traffic. The hotel was close to a lot of restaurants. The bathroom was slippery which I didn't like though it will not deter me from staying here again.
Great bargain. Loved it!!!!!

review.title: Old, but fairly clean.
review.reviewText: The hotel was old and in a bad area. There weren't many places to eat nearby either.

review.title: Hotel Stinks - Literally
review.reviewText: Lobby smelled horrible. The elevator was almost gagging. I would never stay there again.

review.title: Decent hotel near the airport at a good rate
review.reviewText: I was looking for a hotel at a good price that would allow me to take the train into San Francisco for some sightseeing, and then be close to the airport for my flight home. While not a "fancy" hotel, this hotel met those expectations, and I was satisfied with my stay there. Good value for the money, especially if you cannot afford to stay in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Minutes from the Airport and BART station
review.reviewText: No-frills hotel in a safe neighborhood with plenty of restaurants you can walk to if needed after a long day. The hotel was quiet - no pool or bar on premises = no kids or riff-raff. The internet connection was good/fast and the breakfast adequate. If you are looking for a place beyond a comfortable room to sleep in - pay more for a "better" hotel, but we traveled knowing that we were driving or taking the train since it is 20+ (relatively easy) miles to downtown San Fran and our flight out the last morning was early. My only complaint would be that there wasn't enough parking in the lot, but there was always a spot on the street out front and the neighborhood was safe enough that I didn't worry about it. Staff at the front desk were helpful. Considering this is San Fran, this hotel is a great deal if you don't need all the extras.

review.title: not recommended
review.reviewText:
the location is good if you are just passing thru, 5 min drive from SFO, but 30 min from city, depending on traffic. At arrival all the parking spaces in the hotel lot were occupied, i requested a place, or solution, the receptionist was unprofesssional, and not willing to help at all, she said to park outside at the curb, and because there is a 2hr max parking zone there from 7am, I should move the car from there before 9am.
The staff is very unprofessional, the cleaning maids rush into the elevator in front of guests...
only recommend if you are passing thru town, and in need for a one night sleep.

review.title: So, So
review.reviewText: The room was very small and not that convenient to downtown San Francisco via public transportation as expected.

review.title: OK, clean and comfortable but not the ideal location
review.reviewText:
Excellent rates for nice, clean and comfortable rooms with fridge, free Wifi and TV. Good service with free shuttle to/from the airport, which takes about 30 minutes.
We were however disappointed with the hotel location. You need a (free) shuttle or taxi to get to/from the airport, but BART stations are also NOT within walking distance! We stayed in downtown San Francisco, took BART to San Bruno, then took the bus (391 on a Saturday) instead of a taxi, and finally walked for another 5 minutes. No the easiest way to get around.
Maybe a detail: the hotel site mentions HBO, which is not available in the rooms (we made inquiries at the front desk).

review.title: Ok experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was simple. The service was decent. The airport shuttle was timely.

review.title: Not one of our better stays. We won't be back.
review.reviewText: Upon entering the lobby to check in, we were overpowered by the scent of a really bad plug in air freshener or something similar. For someone with asthma and extremely allergic to perfumes, it's a very uncomfortable experience. Since our room was prepaid and we would get nothing back if we canceled our stay, we checked in, hoping for the best. Once we entered our room, we discovered the unpleasant scent was there as well. We immediately cranked up the A/C and opened the window to air it out before leaving. Upon returning, we discovered the toilet seat was hanging on by a thread, the pillows were flat, and the sheets were yellowed. We left a note on the closed toilet seat the next day requesting it be fixed but returned to find our request had been ignored. The accommodations left much to be desired. We will not be returning to this particular location.

review.title: Useful airport hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the airport on a busy road, with nearby fast food restaurants. Apart from the bathroom light failing, which we were too jetlagged to get attended to as we were only staying one night, the room was fine, and the breakfast was good.

review.title: unremarkable good hotel for airport overnight
review.reviewText: This was a good, cheap place for overnight near airport. My plane got in at midnite after a long trip. Had a 3 hour drive facing me so wanted cheap flophouse, This was clean, convenient, unremarkable free bkfst in am. It was all i was looking for.

review.title: if you take early fight, that is perfect hotel. it provides free shuttle to airport
review.reviewText: it is great location and good service for this hotel if you take early fight.

review.title: Not for travelers with flight schedules......
review.reviewText: Coming in from a 6+ hr flight from Montreal at 8:30pm, I had to stand on the sidewalk waiting over an HOUR ( amongst others) for the shuttle for this hotel to arrive. Several of the same shuttles from various hotels came and went, but not Days Inn San Bruno. I arrived at my hotel at 10:30 pm following an 8:30pm arrival at the airport. Additionally I inquired about the shuttle time for my flight out the next morning. The next morning the desk told me a different schedule from the one given to me the night before. Thus I missed my flight, and had to pay for another ticket home on another airline. The hotel itself is so-so. I was able to indulge myself with their complimentary breakfast as I was too busy using their free Wi Fi to book a new flight home.

review.title: Airport stay
review.reviewText: Room was small but did what we needed. We got in very late so it was good place to stop and stay. Had breakfast with waffle maker. Room was clean.

review.title: convenience location for me
review.reviewText:
the reason I pick this hotel is it close to where my relatives' homes are.
also, manager, workers are very nice, friendly.

review.title: Nice hotel for the money paid
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the money paid. Close to airport.

review.title: i like to go back any time
review.reviewText: hotel has a clean room and good customer service ...every think in side the room work .... i like this hotel has a good parking space and a good breakfast ...

review.title: Worth the money.
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anybody. Tanforan Mall is couple of miles away.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: nice place to stay. Close to the airport. BART was close by. I would stay there again.

review.title: Days Inn SFO West, good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: No room issues, however late nite parking in the hotel's lot was hit-or-miss and restocking of breakfast items wasn't very prompt.

review.title: Nice HoJo Stay
review.reviewText: Great airport location, well maintained, quiet, convenient, with free breakfast, parking, internet.

review.title: Ok for 1 or 2 days
review.reviewText: Reception clerks aren't friendly at all. Room is ok; clean. However hotel has this strange smell everywhere.

review.title: Better than getting up at 3:30 AM for an early flight
review.reviewText:
My wife and I had an early flight out of SFO on a Saturday morning. We booked a room at this Days Inn through Expedia, so we could take advantage of the airport shuttle.

I called the hotel several days before arrival to ask if I could park my car there for a week while we were away. It turns out there is a "park and fly" special that would have been a really good deal. It was too late to book that (we'd paid for the room already), but they gave us a decent daily parking rate.

The hotel is easy to find. Parking is inconvenient -- there is no direct access to the hotel lobby from the parking lot. Overall, the place is worn and run down. The doors were severely scuffed by luggage and the carpet is balding. But the room was clean-ish, and the bed was comfortable. The blanket was a little yucky.

The walls are quite thin; we could hear conversation-level voices from the adjacent rooms but we couldn't really make out the words.

The SFO shuttle runs hourly. We took the 6:10 AM shuttle for a 7:35 AM flight and made it in plenty of time, even with a stop at the ticket counter. The shuttle's last departure from the airport is 12:30am. We just missed it and had to pay $15 + tip for a cab ride.

Despite the dinginess we felt like we got a good deal and an extra 2 hours of sleep. It was worth it.

review.title: YUCK
review.reviewText: NEVER again will i use this hotel .

review.title: SFO Airport Hotels
review.reviewText:
Close to airport, plenty of commercial retail shops and restaurants available.
Convenience for someone who is driving.
Free breakfast offered need improvement

review.title: OKAY, BUT NOT GREAT
review.reviewText: Location - GREAT! Staff - friendly, helpful. Price - pretty good. Breakfast - a little limited. Maintenance - a bit shabby around the edges.

review.title: NEVER AGAIN
review.reviewText: NO HOT WATER, CLERK DIDN'T UNDERSTAND ENGLISH. NEVER AGAIN>

review.title: it's ok
review.reviewText: For it's price, it's not bad at all.

review.title: Nice place to stay in San Francisco if you like to drive
review.reviewText: All was fine and it is not a big deal to drive to San Francisco Downtown.

review.title: cheap but not cheerful
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here the other night. We are not fussy travelers, and are traveling on a budget, so this hotel and price fit the bill. I was disappointed being on the first floor, right beside the Days Inn sign glowing on the street. The walls were very thin. You could hear passers by talking and the cars going through the night and morning. The room was tidy, but I wouldn't say it was clean. The TV seemed to only have one channel. The lamp on my side of the bed had no knob to turn it on and no light bulb! The bathroom was ok. There was a hair on the shower wall-- which grosses me out! lol If we came back, I would not stay here again. I was not happy with the overall experience.

review.title: Not the best choice, but OK I guess if the price is right for a one night in and out.
review.reviewText: Hotel was pretty run down and area was a bit rough so would not be out walking the street at night. Pretty convienent to the airport. Hotel was pretty run down though. I would look for other options if you can get something in similiar price range.

review.title: yes, but...
review.reviewText:
not so bad, but elevator was not working due to some breakdown during night, and isolation was not enough; noise from close avenue was too much high in room at morning.
OK for bathroom, & for breakfast with enough space in breakfast room.
Shuttle to go to airport was very convenient; we appreciated it.

review.title: Good hotel for the money!
review.reviewText: we arrived late in the evening but our room was still not fixed. we have to wait for 10-15mins to get it done. Other than that, everything worked fine. The room is nice and clean. For the price, it's a good deal.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, Good budget hotel. enjoyed my stay

review.title: right by the airport!
review.reviewText: Not an amazing hotel but it was literallly minutes from the airport and when you have a 5 am flight thats important. it was clean and comfortable. not a vacation spot but a great pre flight stop. access to all rooms is through the lobby so that made me feel safer. good price, safe, clean.

review.title: Good for airport convenience, bad for light sleepers
review.reviewText: The walls in this hotel are extremely thin. I had a hard time sleeping--I could hear the televisions of every room adjacent to mine. I could also hear conversations as though I was in the room with the people speaking. Overall the hotel was good because it is close to the airport, but I was far from comfortable.

review.title: very good value for money
review.reviewText: We chose Days Inn for its very cheap price and did not expect much from it. We were very nicely surprised to be very welcome and taken care of as soon as we arrived (without mentioning the shuttle that come to pick us up and took us to the airport at 4am), Finding a nice, confortable and tidy bedroom after a long journey was fantastic. Thank you Days Inn.

review.title: Great Price, Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was absolutely wonderful. Very nice room, spacious and comfy. I only had one thing that was a little irritating. The shower head, which honestly in a hotel anywhere what do you expect? We actually accidentally left our electric toothbrush charger in the room and the hotel sent it back to us with no problems. Staff was very helpful & friendly and checking in & out was super easy. Would definetly go back.

review.title: Close to SF Airport
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced hotel less than ten minutes from SF airport. Not fancy but a good place to stay if you have an early morning flight.

review.title: Dirty with poor service
review.reviewText: This Days Inn was way below standards. I was simply looking for a place to sleep and shower on an overnight layover. The shower had gobs of hair stuck to the wall. I don't mean a little piece of hair but handfuls of hair stuck to the wall at eye level. It was disgusting and can only indicate that it had not been cleaned. Furthermore, the shuttle to the airport only runs once an hour on the hour unless you specifically reserve it for a given time which no one had indicated to me when I checked in. This fact was a surprise in the morning when I called ahead about the shuttle at 5:10 and was told it would not be there until 6:00 am. The person at the desk was rude when I asked about a taxi service but called one and asked if a pick up in 40 minutes was ok. She seemed shocked that that seemed to be less than ideal but at least called a cab that was able to arrive in 10 minutes. Overall, I was not expecting much on this stay, just a bed, clean shower and friendly service yet all I got of those three was a bed. This was not a relaxing place to spend a long layover and I would not return in light of the filthy shower and rude service.

review.title: Only if you need a really cheap room
review.reviewText:
Arrived early evening, but "only smoking rooms," which smelled so bad I could not enter. Had to pay $40 for an upgrade, which was actually an okay room, and quite large. However, there was the usual gross stuff (I wouldn't walk barefoot on the carpet) and two hairs left in the bathroom that *obviously* were not mine (I have a crew cut.)

Only stay here if you need a cheap room. It started off that way for me, but after adding $40 because I couldn't stand a smoking room, it was a relatively expensive mistake. Honestly, many hotels, even of this class, are nonsmoking only, so this reflects quite poorly on this one.

review.title: Days Inn San Bruno
review.reviewText:
The person checking me in was by a young guy obviously just in from out running, still in his sweaty tank top and slinky shorts! This place is evidently run by Indians or Pakistanis and it shows a lack of common hospitality decorum.
The room has cigarette burn holes in the drapes and furniture's bed lamp was cracked a the base, towels were the most flimsy ones I have ever had the misfortune to use for a bath, mold in the bath tile grout, big stains in the hallways and in front of the elevator.
Continental breakfast is a obstacle course to capture whatever meager remnants are left behind by the hordes before me. One AM no cereal, milk, breads, waffle mix and I had to hunt the management down to provide refills.
Checking out ,there were several heated discussions going on with others about their stay at the front desk and I was glad to be out of the place!

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Had asked for 2 queen and roll-away but they had one king and a roll-away. Had confirmed needs prior to travel. Staff were very matter a fact after I explained I had confirmed my needs prior to my arrival. Could not accommodate needs it was a take it or leave it kind of attitude. Ended up staying, room was very clean, beds a little too hard and uncomfortable. Breakfast was a little disorganized and had ran out of most food and took a while to replenish it. Had to continuously ask for stuff. Not much to choose from, would have liked fresh fruit. Could not find parking late at night. Overall OK for the $$$ for one or two nights.

review.title: BEWARE.....A waste of money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, the exterior of the motel was clean and new looking. Once inside, I quickly noticed unkept carpet and floors. At the check in counter there was a digital photo frame exhibiting various rooms and floorplans. When I got to my room, I was quite disappointed as the room smelled terrible and the furniture was dirty and stained. I did go back to the check in counter and asked for another room. No such luck. I was told it would be the next day before they could move me. I did shop for cleaning supplies and actually cleaned the room myself. What a fool! The 3rd night of my stay, I returned to my room late in the evening to find that the cleaning staff had not cleaned the room as I had requested, instead making up the bed with the same sheets and the bathroom floor dirty. What really got my goat was was when I realized that someone had opened and eaten some of the snack food that I had purchased and left in my room. I did go immediately to the front desk to and was told that when the manager returned the next day, he would replace the snack food that had been eaten. What a mess. Do you really think that eating the snack food was as important as the fact that I felt violated and did not know whether my possessions had been sifted through??? I quickly made other arrangements for the remainder of my stay. WARNING....do not be fooled by the price and exterior of the building!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: everything was great except for the chair
review.reviewText: the upolstered chair in our room was filthy. another customer commented about the same thing in her room when i mentioned it in the elevator. other than that, everything was fine. the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Decent budget option near SFO.
review.reviewText: Not a fancy place, but cheap and close to the airport. The shuttle doesn't run as often as some of the other similar hotels in the area (e.g., the Clarion), which is a bit of a bummer. On the other hand you can walk to restaurants, shops, etc. from the hotel (unlike the Clarion) which is a big plus.

review.title: It's good if you're only interested in eating breakfast, convenience of parking and sleeping.
review.reviewText: The biggest concern was the walls appear to be paper thin. The first night we arrived, there was a complaint that we were talking too loud or tv was too loud. My sisters and I are middle aged but we're not aware of hearing disabilities. (My hearing was checked last year) We were barely talking above whispers and there were still complaints the following nights. We tried to respect the other guests and their needs for rest and relaxation in peace. Either the walls were paper thin or neighbors were wearing high volume/ magnifying hearing aids. Since my sisters and I are 1100 miles apart, this really put a damper on our fellowship and catching up times.

review.title: A decent deal for the price.
review.reviewText: Our room was clean, but the bed was not as firm as I like, and there is some traffic noise at times. Free wifi was a plus. The shuttle from the airport was timely, and rides to the airport depart hourly. The front desk was courteous in providing info on a nearby church for us. Celia's is a very good Mexican restaurant just couple blocks away.

review.title: bad choice
review.reviewText:
The first room they checked us into had only one bed and a big space where the other one should have been. The room we ended up in had no toilet seat.
Also they only had smoking rooms which we did not want. I found out later that my Expedia reservation called for a smoking room, but I sure was unaware of it.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel near San Francisco airport, this is a good choice. My room was ideal for a one night stopover and there were plenty of restaurants within a couple of blocks. Days provided shuttle service to the airport, about 10 minutes away.

review.title: A good port in a storm
review.reviewText: San Francisco was experiencing unprecedented rainstorms, one after the other. Shuttle service to and from the airport was professional and on time although I thought the hotel somewhat distant from the airport. The room was clean, comfortable and for my simple need of a room for the night, priced attractively.

review.title: Great Last Minute Value
review.reviewText: It was a great last minute value that was $15.00 less than the walk in price. The hotel was surprisingly clean and quiet with a free continental breakfast.. Airport shuttle was fast and professional.

review.title: Comfortable, nice and near SFO airport
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay in comfortable and (comparatively) large room. very convenient if you have an early flight.

review.title: Inexpensive digs
review.reviewText: A great place to stay if you have an early flight from SFO. THere is also a great Japanese restaurant down the blok -- reminded me of the small shops in Tokyo. Great food!

review.title: Great place if that's what you're looking for
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel if that's what you're looking for -- a cheap place to stay for a short period (like an overnight layover), with a nice staff and free and easy transport between the airport and hotel.

review.title: Very pleasant
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect when using SFO airport. It is well maintained and very clean. It is in a perfect location when arriving or leaving SFO. The service is friendly and curtious. The parking is adequate and there are many good restaurants within 2 miles of the hotel. They are used to handling Expedia reservations as the girl had several email reservations when we arrived.

review.title: Inexpensive place to stay before early plane departure
review.reviewText: Interesting; hotel was occupied by a group of French speaking bikers.

review.title: Decent Accommodation, Poorly Managed
review.reviewText: The physical aspects of the hotel were well worth the money. The room was clean, welcoming, and had all of the listed amenities. The breakfast was pleasant. The service, however, was disappointing. Among our problems: -Despite frequent calls, the shuttle did not arrive to pick us up at the airport for an hour. The desk was very disingenuous, promising the shuttle would be there "in a few minutes" or that it was "already at the airport" (up to 45 minutes before he actually arrived). -I asked for an extra child's bed in my Expedia reservation. The desk told me that I did not, although this information was on the confirmation I signed when I arrived. When at 7:30 I asked for the bed, she told me she couldn't have it until 10:30 p.m. She did end up getting a crib to me, but without the slats. The child ended up sleeping on the mattress on the floor, but the desk's response to my requests (you didn't request it, I can't do it, here's something inadequate and unsafe) was totally inappropriate. -We saw the same desk person at the desk for over 24 hours. We were very uncomfortable with this arrangement. It also seemed that, although friendly, she had not been fully trained in customer service (did not repeat our requests to us to confirm, did not confirm requests with a definite yes or no, made excuses rather than solved problems). -When we asked for a bus or train schedule, she said they had no schedules. But the schedules were by the elevator, as we soon discovered.

review.title: Hotel was fine, would use again.
review.reviewText: The room was clean, everything fine. Only complaint was that it had been a room with two queens that was turned into a room with one king, so there were two queen headboards attached to the wall and a lot of open space where another bed had been. That space could have held a small table and a couple of chairs and made the room much more useable.

review.title: Reasonable choice
review.reviewText: All I wanted was a decent priced, clean hotel with airport shuttle service to the SF airport the night before an early flight, and this met my expectations. I would stay there again.

review.title: Days Inn Airport - San Francisco
review.reviewText: While the hotel advertised as having an airport shuttle, we were disappointed to find out that it stops running at midnight, and while another waiting party had a call in for pick up, no one came. Later attempts to reach the hotel were met with busy signals. We ended up taking a cab (to the cost of $40), which was a little bit of a hassle to get reimbursed. We slso had a request for a roll-away bed to be in our room which wasn't in place, so we had to track one down. Unfortunately when it was delivered, there really wasn't any place to open it up for use. Overall the hotel offers a adequate stay for its rate, but the aforementioned hurt its recommendation.

review.title: Convenient hotel near San Francisco Intl. Airport
review.reviewText: We had an early morning flight and decided to stay near the airport. The room was comfortable and clean. The free shuttle in the morning was only a 5 minute ride to the airport termimal ~ very convenient and the hotel was reasonably priced.

review.title: Acceptable Hotel
review.reviewText: Days Inn Intl Airport West, in its class is good.

review.title: Great spot for catching a plane
review.reviewText: minutes from the airport - perfect

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText: The Days Inn was servicable and easy to get to from my work location. The breakfast often ran out of fruit, but the coffee was good and plentiful. The bed was not top rate, but exhaustion made it comfortable. Parking was good and the plantings around the hotel were fascinating. There were many good places to eat near the hotel.

review.title: not recommended
review.reviewText: Complementary shuttle cannot be reached on the phone from the airport, so try and get the number beforehand. Rooms are ok, could be cleaner. There were just too many airfresheners, e. g. in the elevator of all places, so hold your breath!

review.title: Staying in San Fran
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel overnight. After getting to the airport we called the hotel and they sent a taxi ( which they have on contract) for us. The personnel at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We stayed there on both ends of our trip. Upon returning we had to wait for our room but it was not too long and then we got to sleep for several hours undisturbed. We had an early flight and the van came promptly at 5am and off we were. We had no complaints about this hotel.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Good value, it's worth what I paid for. My room was clean and nice. Everything is good. Also, they offer free Wi-Fi.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly, and the room was very clean, the only suggestion is more choices on continental breakfast.

review.title: would go back again
review.reviewText: good place!

review.title: Made early flight from SFO perfect
review.reviewText: Located close to SFO with free cab service to terminals. Not many "tourist" things to do but there are a few restaurants and stores nearby to fill in.

review.title: Good overnight to catch a flight
review.reviewText: The room was clean - clean carpet, bedding, bathroom & shower. The appliances were in good condition and clean. The king sized bed had a generic mattress and was stiff and unforgiving, especially after my 3 hour drive and rush to the airport. The television was an old fashion tube but had good picture, sound and plenty of clear channels to choose from - and the remote worked! The desk clerk could not give directions to the hotel over the phone from the nearest freeway (101) so I was wandering around El Camino Real for 5 minutes longer than necessary ( take the San Bruno exit if going Northbound). She was helpful in calling their cab service (free to guests going to/from SFO) prior to my arrival. The cab ride is about 10 mins long to SFO. Make sure to call them from the Arrivals Taxi line - or you may miss the cab to come back - or give your cell# so the cab can call to find you. The continental breakfast is minimal - coffee, Danish, cold cereal, banana, juice and waffles - not enough to sustain you on your flight or drive home - but not bad for the price of the hotel. Overall: I would use them again for turn-around trips. If they had extended and covered parking for park&fly I would put them at the top of my list.

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText: Easy access to bus service, not far from restaurants and BART system. Screen was broken and never replaced but room was cleaned as requested. Missing refrigerator was quickly supplied.

review.title: Very friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying and we were very pleased with the Day's Inn. Everyone was polite, helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the accomodations were marvelous. We would definetly stay again.

review.title: Good place to stay before your early morning flights
review.reviewText: This hotel was much better than expected for the bargain price we paid. The front desk person was extremely friendly and helpful. There are plenty of places to eat right near the hotel because it is in the town, not out in the middle of a field near the airport. It was a 10 minute cab ride to and from the airport and the hotel picks up the cab fare...however, we recommend you tip the driver (we noticed some people didn't).

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: close to the airport and have a shuttle service. All in all, I had a good experience with this hotel.

review.title: San Francisco Bargain
review.reviewText: Convenient to the airport and to San Francisco (if you've got a car). Clean, safe property at a great price.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: We needed a room just for overnight between flights and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This hotel was just what we wanted. Clean room, great service, close to the airport.

review.title: Excellent location for early morning flying!!!
review.reviewText: Location excellent particularly - due to early morning departure - only a VERY short drive to the airport and well sign-posted. Free continental breakfast was a bonus. Would certainly recommend this hotel - staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Shopping mall in very close proximity.

review.title: Great Airport Value
review.reviewText: This hotel allowed for free parking while I was gone on vacation. Once I returned home, I took the shuttle back to the htoel and picked up my car. Great idea for those who have early morning flights out of SFO.

review.title: Normal Motel
review.reviewText: I only stayed one night. I asked for extra pillows and a blanket and they said they didn't have any. So I was a little disappointed. Other than that I had a pleasent stay. The staff were nice a helpfull.

review.title: Not The Best Stay
review.reviewText: The door-lock/key ssytem in the room we originally were assigned to was not working. We got there, and the door was unlocked. We told thsi to the front-desk person, and he immediatley assigned us a different room, which was great. However, the people hanging out at the lobby did not seem like guests, but friends of the front desk person (maybe). I went to sleep somewhat worried that someone would brake the door or something.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great!

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: The room was a little worse for wear. There were food stains on ceiling next to sprinkler system. The bed was comfortable, linens smelled good. The staff was very nice and helpful. Pizza place across the street had very good pizza!

review.title: Great craxh pad
review.reviewText: The hotel was nothing special, but is an inexpensive night if you need to fly out of SFO. The bathrooms are huge relative to the room sizes, which was kind of fun. Little things are kind of annoying, like the fact that my remote didn't work for te TV. The hotel seems to cater to people from the Orient.
